Cultural Exchange: A universal language would facilitate cultural exchange and understanding between different countries and cultures. It would make it easier for people to learn about and appreciate different cultures.
Economic Benefits: A universal language could lead to economic benefits, as it would make it easier for businesses to operate internationally and for people to find jobs abroad.

Education: A universal language could make education more accessible to people around the world. It would make it easier for people to access educational resources and for educators to share knowledge and ideas.
Diplomacy: A universal language could make diplomacy more effective, as it would make it easier for diplomats to communicate with each other and for governments to negotiate and resolve conflicts.
Tourism: A universal language could make tourism more accessible and enjoyable for people from different countries. It would make it easier for tourists to navigate and explore new places.
